response: If this man is guilty, he deserves to burn. Alive, if possible.
I cherish those moments when I forget just how dark this world can be.
What a mess! He couldn't just quit while he was ahead, could he?
I don't have much to say about her.
I wonder whether sending people to prison really helps them be better people or if we're just separating them from the rest of us so they can't do any more harm.
Money buys me all of the things I love in this world: designer clothes, chocolatey desserts, and the most important part of the day, my morning coffee.
But let's pump the brakes a little bit here. Murdering your girlfriend to steal her father's inheritance is not okay. I don't care how many double-chocolate ice cream cakes it buys you.
There's something about that guy. Like he has some sort of a grudge against the defendant.
I find guns pretty interesting. Actually, I find most things interesting. I just like asking people about their hobbies.

text: Which piece of evidence should we examine first?
I think we should talk about the coworker. He testified against the defendant's alibi that he was at work until 7 PM.
Wait, how do we know that the girl was shot by that shotgun and not some other shotgun?

You got to see a real life crime scene? That's so exciting!
Oh man, those photos they showed. I swear there was a gallon of blood on his face!
Maybe one of the officers put the cuffs on right after he was punched.
There was something his coworker said that really threw me.
They asked him if the defendant had stayed late that night and he said that he handn't.
But then they asked him if the defendant regularly stayed late after work and he started going off on some sort of tangent about the defendant's "work ethic".

What if the coworker lied about not having seen him to get him indicted and off the project?
But why would he just lie like that? I think he would have needed some reason for it.

acquitEntirely: If he later turns out to be guilty, I'll personally go over there and haul him to jail myself.
chargeWithAssault: That poor officer! Being arrested is no excuse for doing something like that.
completelyGuilty: I hope that poor lady can rest in peace with us bringing her killer to justice.
guiltyShotgun: It's too clear that he fired the shotgun. It was him for sure.
guiltyMotivePlusOpportunity: He was there at the scene of the crime and he had reason to do it.
